alert.note: Alert for Grand Canyon Country; Kaibab Plateau (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 28 at 2:17PM MST until December 28 at 11:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM MST THIS EVENING ABOVE 4500 FEET... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow above 4500 feet. New snow accumulations generally ranging from 2 to 5 inches, with lesser amounts below 5000 feet and locally higher amounts above 7000 feet. Southwest winds gusting to near 40 mph at times, leading to areas of blowing snow. * WHERE...Areas above 4500 feet near Fredonia, Grand Canyon, Jacob Lake, and North Rim. * WHEN...Until 11 PM MST this evening. * IMPACTS...Slippery and snow covered roads could lead to very difficult travel. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility at times. Additional snow forecast through 11 PM Tonight: Fredonia up to 1 inch. Grand Canyon 4 to 6 inches. Jacob Lake 6 to 8 inches. North Rim 6 to 12 inches.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
